ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned several concepts that help articulate the experience of being Black in America.
I really appreciate the wealth of knowledge that Professor Anderson was able to share with us.
I learned alot about navigating a white space as a Black student at a predominantly white institution. This was an amazing course.
just an absurd about of african american history. in addition to that he put words to feelings/experiences that i have as a black man
Great knowledge on history and social dynamics.
I learned that racism is way way more complex than is probably understood and its actually hard to create a definition that fully satisfies every aspect of racism.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course content was interesting and something I hadn't explored before but the course could have been more engaging by having group discussions and having more structure to the class would have made it a less stressful experience (i.e. knowing when papers would be due earlier).
I wish we had a more defined syllabus with the breakdown of assignments for the entire year.

This class could be organized in a much better manner. I did feel as though the same topics were discussed throughout each class. After the third class, I can definitely say that I wasn't learning anything new. This however could also be a strenght in that we were allowed the opportunity to apply the cultural theories we learned to the books that we read and current situations having to do with racial injustice.

Weakness: the reading material is wayyyy too dense and theres usually a lot to read and its just this academic nonsense that even the professor makes fun of so like I just think if you as the professor dont like that kind of writing you shouldnt give your students reading material that is that kind of writing.
The TAs where not really that great they were kind of pretentious. Mine I swear always just talked down to me and made me feel like I was stupid and that everything I said was wrong which really didnt foster an environment when I felt I could speak out and be wrong, until I got one of the top scores on the midterm paper and when I tell you it was night and day between the way he treated me after that it was gross. 

Goff had not alot of office hours like they were pretty limited to just one day and they filled up fast and they were very short which wasnt great so when I would schedule to meet with him for a paper which I did for my midterm and final because it was so short a time it actually made it worse for me bc I was left with more questions than answers bc he was talking to me like we had an hour to have a conversation so none of the thoughts were compete in 15min so I always left more confused. 

Strengths: only one and that is that dr.Goff is a fantastic lecturer.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to any and every Black student at yale.
